post.description: Creates a new [Conversation](#schema_conversation). When creating a new [Conversation](#schema_conversation), the required tags must be provided. See the specific integration for more details.

get.description: Retrieves a list of [Conversation](#schema_conversation) you’ve previously created. The conversations are returned in sorted order, with the most recent appearing first. The list can be filtered using [Tags](#tags).

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Provide the `meta.nextToken` value provided in the last API response to retrieve the next page of results

get.description: Retrieves the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) object for a valid identifier.

put.description: Update a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) object by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a [Conversation](#schema_conversation). It cannot be undone. Also immediately deletes corresponding [Messages](#schema_message).

post.description: Retrieves the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) object for a valid identifier. If the conversation does not exist, it will be created.
Creates a new [Event](#schema_event). When creating a new [Event](#schema_event), the required tags must be provided. See the specific integration for more details.

get.description: Retreives a list of [Event](#schema_event) you’ve previously created. The events are returned in sorted order, with the most recent appearing first.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Provide the `meta.nextToken` value provided in the last API response to retrieve the next page of results

get.description: Retrieves the [Event](#schema_event) object for a valid identifiers.

post.description: Creates a new [Message](#schema_message). When creating a new [Message](#schema_message), the required tags must be provided. See the specific integration for more details.

get.description: Retrieves a list of [Messages](#schema_message) you’ve previously created. The messages are returned in sorted order, with the most recent appearing first. The list can be filtered using [Tags](#tags).

parameters.name: nextToken

post.description: Retrieves the [Message](#schema_message) object for a valid identifier. If the message does not exist, it will be created.

get.description: Retrieves the [Message](#schema_message) object for a valid identifier.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a [Message](#schema_message). It cannot be undone.

post.description: Creates a new [User](#schema_user). When creating a new [User](#schema_user), the required tags must be provided. See the specific integration for more details.

get.description: Retrieves a list of [User](#schema_user) previously created. The users are returned in sorted order, with the most recent appearing first. The list can be filtered using [Tags](#tags).

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Provide the `meta.nextToken` value provided in the last API response to retrieve the next page of results

parameters.name: conversationId
parameters.description: Filter by conversation id. This will return all users that have participated in the conversation.

get.description: Retrieves the [User](#schema_user) object for a valid identifier.

put.description: Update a [User](#schema_user) object by setting the values of the parameters passed. Any parameters not provided will be left unchanged.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a [User](#schema_user). It cannot be undone.

post.description: Retrieves the [User](#schema_user) object for a valid identifier. If the user does not exist, it will be created.

title.description: Title of the integration. This is the name that will be displayed in the UI

description.description: Description of the integration. This is the description that will be displayed in the UI

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [User](#schema_user) in the ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [User](#schema_user) in the ISO 8601 format

tags.description: Set of [Tags](#tags) that you can attach to a [User](#schema_user). The set of [Tags](#tags) available on a [User](#schema_user) is restricted by the list of [Tags](#tags) defined previously by the [Bot](#schema_bot). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

User.description: The user object represents someone interacting with the bot within a specific integration. The same person interacting with a bot in slack and messenger will be represented with two different users.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) in the ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) in the ISO 8601 format

channel.description: Name of the channel where the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is happening

integration.description: Name of the integration that created the [Conversation](#schema_conversation)

tags.description: Set of [Tags](#tags) that you can attach to a [Conversation](#schema_conversation). The set of [Tags](#tags) available on a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is restricted by the list of [Tags](#tags) defined previously by the [Bot](#schema_bot). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

Conversation.description: The conversation object represents an exchange of messages between one or more users. A [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is always linked to an integration's channels. For example, a Slack channel represents a conversation.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Event](#schema_event) in the ISO 8601 format

payload.description: Payload is the content of the event defined by the integration installed on your bot or one of the default events created by our api.

Event.description: The event object represents an action or an occurrence.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [Message](#schema_message) in the ISO 8601 format

type.description: Type of the [Message](#schema_message) represents the resource type that the message is related to

payload.description: Payload is the content type of the message. Accepted payload options: Text, Image, Choice, Dropdown, Card, Carousel, File, Audio, Video, Location

tags.description: Set of [Tags](#tags) that you can attach to a [Conversation](#schema_conversation). The set of [Tags](#tags) available on a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) is restricted by the list of [Tags](#tags) defined previously by the [Bot](#schema_bot). Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them.

Message.description: The Message object represents a message in a [Conversation](#schema_conversation) for a specific [User](#schema_user).

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [State](#schema_state) in the ISO 8601 format

updatedAt.description: Updating date of the [State](#schema_state) in the ISO 8601 format

name.description: Name of the [State](#schema_state) which is declared inside the bot definition

type.description: Type of the [State](#schema_state) represents the resource type (`conversation`, `user`, `bot` or `integration`) that the state is related to

payload.description: Payload is the content of the state defined by your bot.

State.description: The state object represents the current payload. A state is always linked to either a bot, a conversation or a user.

botId.description: ID of the bot the file will be used for

name.description: Optional arbitrary file name (e.g. my-image.jpg), will be used for display purposes only.

createdAt.description: Creation date of the [File](#schema_file) in ISO 8601 format

size.description: Size of the file in bytes

publicUrl.description: Public URL to the file contents, available only if the access type is public. If the file is private, use the Download endpoint to retrieve the file contents.

updateConversationResponse.description: Returns an updated [Conversation](#schema_conversation) object if a valid identifier was provided. Returns [an error](#errors) otherwise

deleteConversationResponse.description: Returns the [Conversation](#schema_conversation) object that was deleted
